Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: KK10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked away by campo di fiori, in a great location for all things touristy the vatican is to your left when getting on to the main road, and the collesuem roughly to your right all be it a long walk. Piazzo Nova, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain are pleasant 20-30 min walk away. The hotel rooms, service and staff are all excellent, with good advice on what to do when out and about. The breakfasts were excellent, I have seen others comment about the breakfast rooms being cramped but deary me thats just knit-picking to be honest. My two best bits of advice for a trip to Rome is to get the Roma pass at the tourist information to que jump at some attractions and free use of the local transport and go to a gelato for some ice cream.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: donatelloUk
Reviews.Content: Situation just off Campo de Fiori this hotel is the perfect location. It has been refurbished recently and the finish on the rooms is excellent. Staff were very friendly and helpful. I have been to Rome previously and this hotel was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Quality small hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Ascotsquirrel
Reviews.Content: We visited the Lunetta in October 2011, only a few months after its renovation had been completed. This was our first trip to Rome and we chose the hotel on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews; and were very glad we did. The Lunetta is a small hotel, perfectly located for most of the major sites, in a quiet piazza just off the Campo de Fiori; and is within a 20 minute walk of the Coloseum, Spanish steps and Vatican City. The standard of decor and fittings was high, although at the time of our visit the spa had not yet opened. This wasn’t of concern to us, although I would imagine that a quick dip in the pool would be welcome at the end of a long day sightseeing if visiting Rome during the summer months. We stayed in one of the standard rooms which, although not huge, was more than adequate by European standards. The room and en-suite were, like the rest of the hotel, tastefully decorated and immaculately clean. The only down-side was a rather uninspiring view from our window into a closed courtyard – but otherwise no complaints. At the top of the hotel there’s a small roof-terrace – we took a drink up with us to enjoy the last of the early evening sun prior to going out to dinner. Breakfast is provided in 2 rooms next to reception, and offered a good selection of both continental and cooked food. There’s a very good restaurant immediately next door to the hotel – the “Hostaria Costanza”, which, like the hotel, is built into the remains of the original walls of the Teatro Pompeo. It’s well worth a visit – good quality unpretentious local fare. We e-mailed the hotel in advance of our stay and they booked us a table for our first night (as well as private transfers to and from the airport). The reception staff at the Lunetta were professional, helpful and courteous throughout. A couple of other things: 1) October turned out to be an ideal month to visit Rome – temperatures still very warm (mid 20’s C during the day), without being uncomfortable. 2) We had read quite a few scare stories about pickpockets before we went – but to be honest, felt just as safe as we have in any other major European city. I think it’s just a case of being aware and taking sensible precautions. We spent a packed 4 days in Rome – absolutely loved the city – and the Lunetta was a wonderful base to return to after a day slogging the streets. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Allybob3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights during Easter week. The hotel is new and spotlessly clean. The rooms are well appointed and beds very comfortable. The staff were extremely helpful and spoke very good English. Breakfasts are good, but there is limited seating space so get there early or you'll have to wait. As one previous poster mentioned we did encounter some intermittent internet access but not so as to greatly inconvenience us. The hotel is perfectly located within walking instance of all the main tourist sites. A really nice boutique hotel that we'll stay in again next time we come to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a find”
Reviews.Author: StuartLiverpool
Reviews.Content: A party of seven of us arrived on Monday last for a four night stay. Admittedly it did not start promisingly being told that two of us had been over booked and we had to spend one night elsewhere which they arranged. It was a mistake but like all mistakes if handled skillfully a crisis is averted. We moved back in the next day and had an absolutely splendid time. The management couldn't do enough for our party. It is a clean stylish hotel, certainly the best we've stayed in, in Rome. Breakfasts are good and plentiful and the place runs like clockwork. It is perfectly situated for walking to all the major attractions. Wow! Quite a find.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SmarterTools I
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new (in 2011) and beautiful. Multiple rooftop gardens and a beautiful breakfast room and coffee bar. The rooms were modern and beautifully decorated. The bathrooms are very spacious especially by Rome standards. The location near Piazza Nuova is wonderful. The staff is very friendly and all spoke perfect English. Breakfast is included and very good, plenty of variety and very fresh. By far the best breakfast offered at any of the hotels we've stayed at in Europe. Unfortunately, their Internet did not work for our entire stay. But other than that we had a very nice stay. We would definitely stay there again with the hope that they do whatever is necessary to fix the Internet issues for us business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great break for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: Ruffington
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Rome with our toddler during the great snow storm of 2012. The hotel was very clean, had a nice balance of old style and trendiness. Great location for food at nearby restaurants and walking distance to major attractions. (There is also a cake store 2 doors down which sells the most amazing cupcakes.) Our first room was too far from the elevators. There were many small flights of stairs which were difficult to maneuvere with a stroller and unbearable while carrying a 13 kg toddler after a long day of walking. The staff kindly moved us to a closer room upon request. The breakfast dining room does not have a high chair but has comfortable benches and the staff is very helpful in pointing out good locations for energetic children. The spa/jacuzzi was great after roaming the city. Note - you must prebook at reception, as there is limited capacity. Also, guests must pay to use it on the weekends. This is very disappointing since we paid so much for the hotel. Overall a good experience, and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best !”
Reviews.Author: Caroline P
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the basis of the very good reviews it has received and the great location. We were not disappointed in any respect !! The hotel was beautiful - stylish, elegant , spotlessly clean, very comfy beds with good quality bed linen and lots of towels. Friendly, helpful, super smiley staff . We arrived much earlier than check in time - but no problem we checked in anyway and even were upgraded to a larger family suite. Everything is so pristine and clean ! Breakfasts were great with a very good selection- fresh fruit, yoghurts, cheeses, pastries, rolls,eggs and bacon. We had to return on an early flight so the hotel happily provided us with a bagged Breakfast to take away and even came outside to wave us off !! The location is fantastic you can walk everywhere and it is so close to many restaurants ( great little sandwich shop dead opposite perfect for a late night snack / coffee /beer. Also very friendly there too ) Can't think of a single negative thing to say. we had a brilliant time and would return very willingly. Thankyou Hotel Lunetta. Great job !!

Reviews.Title: “Had a perfect time”
Reviews.Author: sunflower186368
Reviews.Content: In an ideal part of Rome to explore & handy for further afield, away from main roads, situated in an area with cobbled streets, & many cafes & squares. We specifically enjoyed nearby L'Insulatata Ricca Ristorante Largo dei Chiavari, with varied menus for all tastes. The Hotel Lunetta is historic, & tastefully modernised. Breakfast very good. Staff extremely helpful & friendly & conversed with much English. Rooms a good size, comfortable & clean, but storage would be a bit cramped for two people.The street facing room noisy at night, room not facing street quiet. Very happy stay & would like to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and quality”
Reviews.Author: Steeeeve
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, recently modernised. Breakfast buffet was excellent with a wide range of fruit, bread, pastries, cakes, cereal, yoghurt, cheese and cold meats. Plus scrambled egg and fired bacon, nice touch! Hotel staff were all friendly and helpful, and all spoke excellent English. The Hotel's location couldn't be better, just round the corner from Campo Di Fiori and within 30 minutes walk of the Coloseum and Vatican. Only minor complaint was that the room was a bit warm.

Reviews.Title: “Would return again without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: HeatherPortland_Me
Reviews.Content: I adored this hotel! It was spotlessly clean, which for me is a huge plus. The front desk staff was very helpful in a friendly, familiar sort of way- not stuffy at all- and they made some restaurant recommendations that were exactly spot-on. The decor is a perfect mix of contemporary chick and charming character. I absolutely loved walking through the hotel everyday. The websight pictures really do accurately depict the hotel. We always felt very safe here. The breakfast was similar to all Italian hotel breakfasts: lots of fruit, meats, eggs and pastries- which were gorgeous. Also, as noted, some of the best coffee/ caffe in Rome. (we were vibrating by the end of the stay :) Our room was small, tiny by US standards, but we had ample space for four suitcases. We found the temperature in the room comfortable and easily adjusted. The bathroom was gorgeous, also small but with enough room to spread out toiletries and get ready in the morning. (and again, flawlessly clean). Additional toiletries were provided and were very nice quality. The size of the room didn't bother us, since we weren't planning on spending much time there. Best part was the location. Absolutely gorgeous part of Rome for visitors. It's on a side street but our cab driver knew exactly where it was. I wouldn't recommend hanging out or eating in Campo de fiori (that really is too touristy), but the surrounding streets and neighborhoods are wonderful. Very easy walk to piazza navona, pantheon, Jewish ghetto, shopping. Vatican is a little farther- we took a cab because we were running late and it was less than 5 minute drive. I have no cons to report. This is a boutique hotel- not a big US chain, so some amenities like 24 hour room service are not available. However, we wanted the character, and will absolutely stay here if we are lucky enough to visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Sad to say good bye!”
Reviews.Author: alymcc123
Reviews.Content: I never wrote a review before but was inspired to by our exceptional experience at Hotel Lunetta. I have never been at a hotel whose staff made you feel so welcome and happy you were there! It was really hard to say good-bye to everyone after an 8 nights stay! I was surprised to see any reviews that were less than stellar. The location is fantastic, the decor is beautiful, the rooms are immaculate (with no problems with temperature or hot water), the roof terrace delightful, and the spa a nice perk. Since we were there the whole week, they offered to make us anything we wanted for breakfast but the buffet was extensive enough that it was satisfying. (I recommend ricotta cheese on warm toast drizzled with honey.) We loved Rome and were sad to leave. But there is no doubt that having to depart the hotel, itself, contributed to our melancholy mood. We look forward to going back to Rome and our friends at the Hotel Lunetta!

Reviews.Title: “Reviewing excursion in Rome - Ten nights of experience and review”
Reviews.Author: Italo-specialista
Reviews.Content: The objective of my visit was for the Art Cities Exchange Workshop and Hotel Reviews. I have the opportunity to review accommodations for Experience Italy. We discovered a new one near the Campo Fiori. Our key factors in our reviews are Place, Position and People. This hotel has all three - a great position near a lively place call Campo Fiori and a short distance from the Piazza Navona. The Lunetta has a great manager with Luca Rombi, who is a major reason that we are using the hotel. Roberto on day shift was very helpful with some advice with a camera issue and sent me to the place nearby to get it fix. The in-the-middle-of-the guy got me at oh-dark-thirty with a bagged breakfast on the way to the airport. The rooms are very new and the only issues was the temperature control. Just know that a quick call to the desk and they can make that little adjustment in the central system that you might need. I'll be back in October!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: AlliLloyds
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one-week stay at Hotel Lunetta. We loved the location, as we could easily walk to all of the sites and there were lots of great restaurants in the area. The location really can't be beat! We used the spa which we also enjoyed. Since the spa is small, you have to book in advance to use it, even if you are not paying for a service (like a massage, etc.) The first day we went down to use the spa there were young children running around/jumping in the pool, which wasn't ideal...but the next day it was calmer. The rooms are nicely done and comfortable. Like most European city hotels, the rooms are not huge, but just fine in size. Our only small issue was with the front desk at times. The employees were helpful at the front desk and cheery for the most part, but when asked to book a table for us at a very well-known restaurant for dinner, they seemed very perplexed - and we were never able to actually figure out if they had made the reservation on our behalf (we went to the restaurant and took care of it ourselves!) Generally at hotels of this caliber this is not an issue... The breakfast is just fine - although it did not change much from day to day, it was not such a huge issue, as there were a few choices to be had.

Reviews.Title: “expensive”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Great location close to the center of Rome and to most of the attractions. The hotel is located between Piazza Navona and Campo de Fiori. Friendly staff. The hotel is stylish, just renovated and very clean. Rooms are nice and clean. Breakfast was very good. The rate was too high for this experience.

Reviews.Title: “great location yet a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: zrekkal1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Lunetta is definitely the definition of good average. The location (Navona) is the best in all Rome, especially if it is your first time. The hotel is very clean, the staff is friendly. Our room (No 209) was spacious, yet without enough storage space. Our bathroom was very beautiful with Italian marbles, it also had a window opening to the street, we loved it. There was no hot water when I showered for the first 2 mornings, it was barely warm. But the last day, the water was O.K. The wireless internet was broken during our visit, for a whole 3 days. The receptionist said it was the internet company's fault so I understand they had nothing to do. But they didn't seem at all disturbed or apologetic by this inconvenience. They could have done something, anything to compensate. The hotel has a spa, with Rome's famous thermal baths. I recommend you to take your swimming suits, we didn't and I regret it. The hotel has no room service, which was not a problem for us. The restaurant right on left is great, I definitely recommend it. Overall, the hotel was average, and compared to the price, 200 euros per night, it should have been better. I think I will try some other hotel when I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Generally poor but great location”
Reviews.Author: Heather R
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with the hotel services especially the breakfast setup....shocking lack of space and selection for a 4* hotel. No iron and pay tv has to be done via reception!!! My husband and I stayed for 3 nights, booked a suite and we didn't have one hot shower! Not good enough especially as it was January and again not 4* standard. Room had no view and a big noisy air conditioning unit outside the room. Heating was also turned off....not worth the money in any way:( Rome was fabulous though:)

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: daisy310
Reviews.Content: very centrally located hotel, compact clean very helpfull staff, but not intrusive. We had a wonderful short stay in Rome, breakfast was a buffet with plenty to choose from hot and cold. rooms were located at the top of the building lovely veiws and decor. thank you to all the staff at Hotel Lunetta from the Wilson Family IRELAND

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stillaroamin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this hotel for 4 days in December 2011. The hotel staff are absolutely wonderful, very friendly and helpful and have a good knowledge of the area. If they don't know - they will find out. The rooms are lovely, not huge but nicely furnished and spotless. Breakfast is a little hit and miss and finding a piece of moudly bread in the bread basket one morning was a little off-putting! The spa in the basement is truly truly amazing - you MUST use it!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, stylish and friendly”
Reviews.Author: geebLondon
Reviews.Content: I had very high hopes of the Lunetta and I was not disappointed. We had a very stressful ride from the airport with a very objectionable taxi driver and it was a huge relief to come into the oasis of calm of the Lunetta reception. The likes: - reception and breakfast staff were all friendly and informative, - stylish decor - cleaniness - all was spick and span - nice linens and towels - lovely bathroom with great shower (good pressure/ plenty hot water) - very quiet, our room was at the front but when the window was closed you heard nothing - the window overlooking the little piazza to the front of the hotel and windowseat - though small the bed had a good quality mattress and was comfortable - decent buffet breakfast - location, probabaly can't be bettered, you can walk everywhere The not so goods: - the bedroom was tiny. I can't remember which number room we had but it was on the first floor at the front, looking over the piazza (on the left as you face the hotel). The bed was a small double but looked and felt smaller as the large pillows had to be arranged as for a single bed rather than a double. There was only about a foot on one side (next to the cupboards) and only about 2 foot max on the other. We took it in turns to move around the room - it was almost impossible to both be moving at the same time - one of the cupboards had no bar to hang clothes from rendering it almost useless for storing anything but bags and shoes - some of the bathroom fittings were coming loose We didn't really test out the internet or the TV (didn't seem to be an English channel). I suppose we could have made a fuss about the room and asked to be moved but for the four days we were there it was fine. All the essentials were good and it was very pleasant for the minimal time we spent in it awake. The little window seat hidden behind the curtain also provided a quiet private space for reading/chilling - a boon and unbelievable in such a small room. Final Tips: Try the restaurant next door (I can't remember its name but go out of Lunetta and it is first on the right). We were recommended it by Lunetta reception on the first night when we wanted somewhere close. We were a bit sceptical but went anyway and had the best overall restaurant experience we had in Rome. Delicious food, great atmosphere (it is in one of the old amphitheatre), good service and reasonably priced. Also Trastevere is only a short walk away - great atmosphere in the evening and cheaper Would we return? Very probably

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Licenciada
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights October 2011. The hotel was more than we expected! We searched for a good price and this was reasonable... So we thought it might be too good o be true. We were not disappointed! Breakfast was substantial. Staff was friendly and helpful. Free wi-fi. The hotel is clean and quiet. Rooms are typical European boutique size. Bathroom is spacious and clean. Location is excellent. Walk everywhere... Even for us Texans who NEVER walk. At night go people watch and have wine/pizza at Piazza Navona. I have recommended hotel to many people and they love it. Great for couples, friends... Maybe not for small kids.

Reviews.Title: “Near Campo de' Fiori”
Reviews.Author: Kaz I
Reviews.Content: I have to recommend this hotel who seeks exellent services by hotel staffs. Room was clean, and mordern, breakfast was great and saved us from spending $$$ in near by cafe with so-so taste. Only steps away from Campo de' Fiori, 5min (or less) walk to Piazza Navona, Trastevere, Tervi Fountain, Pantheon and Spanish Steps were all within our walking distances. Found several nice upscale restaurant and budget-yet excellent local restaurant in walking distance as well. They have indoor pool and sauna in the basement level, and looks like they are gearing up for spa service as well in the future. (not confirmed, still under construction) Only reason I have 4 on Value, Sleep Quality, Rooms and Restaurant is as follows: Value - Is this hotel cheap? No, but service and quality they provide makes up more than cost. After all, we were in Rome near most notable Campo de' Fiori. Sleep Quality - Bed was near king size if not king size bed. Only problem is we are used to sleep in softer beds. linens used were very nice. we also had similar hardness(?) of beds in other parts of Italy, and in Japan as well, so it's probably what my body is used to at my own house. Rooms - It was very nice and well decorated. only thing I am going to mention is one of the base board will need repair (nail back into wall/ or glue to wall, I think) That's it, very minor. Restaurant - Not exactly restaurant since they only serves breakfast. But Breakfast was great in the category of service (prompt), food selection and quality of food. I highly recommend to anyone who wants to stay near...well almost everything. Bus stops are close enough from this hotel (3 min walk) for Vatican and Colosseum/Forum.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel, best locación, perfección.”
Reviews.Author: Arensua
Reviews.Content: We couldnt find a better hotel, better location in Rome. This hotel is all about perfection. Service is great. The rooms are sooo clean and spacious. The entire hotel smells so good. The breakfast its very good. Small and cozy breakfast room, but the best breakfast we had in comparison with other cities we went. A variety of juices and real scramble eggs. Lunetta hotel impressed us in many ways. Location, the best location you can have in Rome. Walking distance to all the main sights. 1 minute from Campo D' FIore, Colusseum, fontana di trevi, pantheon, Spanish steps, everything. We go back to Rome, hotel Lunetta will be our hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel very convenient”
Reviews.Author: chocolatebunny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights here and we were very impressed, the service was excellent and the hotel was spotless. You could walk to all the main tourist attractions and there were so many lovely restuarants within a 5 minute walk. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: e103db
Reviews.Content: Opened last July it's in the middle of the best turistic part of Rome, touching Campo dei Fiori and Piazza Navona. Service are willing to please and very professional. Rooms are good but you have to get a large one. We were given one where we cannot move! But they changed us into a good one immediately. A couple of things did not turned out well: Wi-Fi and hot water. But overall a fairly good place.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: chrisinyvr
Reviews.Content: After a week in Paris we made our way to Rome and stayed at the Hotel Lunetta for seven nights which enabled us to get a good feel for the area and hotel. I did a lot of research and read a lot of reviews before deciding to book the hotel even though there was not a lot of information available at the time of booking . The hotel as others have mentioned has just recently reopened after extensive renovations from top to bottom.The renovations and finishes are high quality and the pictures on the hotel website are quite accurate . At the time of our stay in October the spa was still not open . For us the best thing about Hotel Lunetta is it's location , on Piazza del Paradiso which is very quiet and next to Campo de Fiori and a short walk to Piazza Navona . While the area in front of the hotel is quiet both Campo de Fiori and Piazza Navona are alive with activity day and night . This is such a beatiful historic part of Rome with cafes, bars,restaurants everywhere . The hotel is located very central so that most of the major tourist sites are within an easy 15-20 walk . During our week in Rome we were able to walk everywhere from the hotel and never needed to take a taxi or bus . Checkin/out went very smooth and all the front desk staff was very kind and helpful speaking english was never an issue . The staff were always happy to book tours or print off vouchers for our tours when needed . We had a room with a small window that faced the Piazza del Paradiso , the windows must be extremely thick as we heard next to no street noise . The classic double room was a bit smaller than we were expecting ,fully aware hotel rooms in Europe are small . It was a very comfortable room with a mini bar and free wi-fi . The room did not have a coffee maker or a clock which would have been nice . The wi-fi worked with no major connection problems and the fact it was free was a bonus . The bathroom was extremely spacious and very well equipped with everything including a rain shower . For us we found the room lacked storage space such as a dresser,since we stayed 7 days we really wanted to unpack our clothes and put our suitcases away . Not a deal breaker but we had to stack our luaggage on the floor in a corner as we had no bench or luggage rack to sit them . Overall even though the room was small it was very comfortable and suited our needs just fine . The two small breakfast rooms have large windows that look out over the piazza and are very pleasant to eat breakfast in.Breakfast included all the basics and there was always plenty of food and the service was very good . My one big complaint does have to with breakfast and nothing to do with the quality of food or service . Nothing changed !! While i realize the choices for breakfast are limited the food was exactly the same,day after day nothing changed right down to the scrambled eggs and bacon ! By day seven I couldn't even look at the scrambled eggs and bacon let alone eat them ! NOTE TO HOTEL LUNETTA Please change some of your breakfast items from time to time. While our stay at Hotel Lunetta was very nice and the location is near perfection there are a couple of observations that we made . On the internet and hotel website the classic double room rates vary a lot , I have seen the room go from EUR 189/379 USD 268/537 and higher . We were lucky I guess and averaged around USD 300 night and when you check out they collect a hotel tax of EUR 3 per person / per night . This is only our opinion but this room is not worth USD 400/500 night for what you get , if you end up paying over USD 400 night for a classic double room I think you will be disappointed . Our other observation was when we were checking out and asked about a taxi to the airport and were quoted EUR 45 but when we crossed the street to the taxi stand the rate is EUR 40 and is posted inside the taxi .Not sure why a higher rate at the hotel ? This is a great hotel in a great location and if you can book it for a reasonable rate do yourself a favour and stay here , you won't regret it . If you are a first time visitor to Rome as we were don't miss Trastevere and Galleria Borghese.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, well appointed rooms, very good service”
Reviews.Author: BSG100
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel several months ago. From the discussion forums and reviews, it appeared to be a new hotel and we booked it based on the pcitures on the website. This hotel has been open for 3 months. It is very well decorated and rooms are well appointed. Bathrooms are new and luxurious. The location is excellent, very close to the Jewish quarters and almost equidistant to all major attractions such as Vatican, Roman Forum, Spanish steps etc. The location is close to verious Piazza'a with many restaurants. Next door is a very nice restaurant located in the catacombes of the old Arena where purportedly Julius Caesar was killed. The front desk staff is professional and friendly. Breakfast is very nice and leaves nothing to wish for. I would have no hesitation to recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: slfrenchca
Reviews.Content: According to the hotel manager, Hotel Lunetta was opened in the summer, 2011. As such, it is updated, modern, and clean. It also means that there are a lot of kinks that need to be worked out, specifically with regard to customer service. To summarize the positive: As mentioned above,t he hotel was clean, modern, and comfortable. Additionally, the breakfast was fabulous and they were able to accomodate a gluten-free diet (required because of Celiac disease). The negative: The room was TINY! It was the smallest room that we had in our entire European excursion. Our main complaint was the customer service. We had a car (bad decision) that we were driving throughout Italy. They told us to park in a certain location but didn't help with any specifics...they didn't tell us we needed coins, what spots were okay to park in, etc. This was despite asking several times. Long story short, we got towed. When we asked for help in locating our car, they were extremely unhelpful and defensive. I don't know if part of the defensiveness is cultural (this was noticed throughout our experiences Italy) but rather than helping they were blaming. We wanted to solve the problem and get our car back (we were in problem solving mode) and they wanted to blame us rather than helping. The manager was also intent on blaming rather than problem solving. We would definitely return to Rome. Would we stay at Hotel Lunetta again? Likely not...at least not until they get completely on their feet. Also, although their photos indicate a spa, etc, this was not available at the time of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent last-minute find”
Reviews.Author: K B
Reviews.Content: I wandered into Hotel Lunetta after a terrible experience elsewhere, and this couldn't have been more opposite. Modern, clean rooms and friendly, helpful staff. I bargained the room rate down last minute on a Sunday. Make sure to check out the roof deck! The gym promised in the literature was nonexistent, but everything else was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: VitelloTonatto
Reviews.Content: We had to find a last minute accommodation in Rome for a group of girls and happened to find this Hotel. Arriving with not expectations we were so positively surprised. Very modern but cosy interior, best central location to be able to walk to many places and very, very friendly and helpful staff. We just loved our lucky choice.

Reviews.Title: “A bit Pricey”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler070
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Hotel Lunetta and the hotel was very chic and modern. My room did not have a window and was quite small, but it did have a great shower and perfect linens. The location was just mext to Campo de Fiore and just blocks away from Piazza Navona. Super fun night life at both places. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast was wonderful. I would stay here again, although a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Tim B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Lunetta from Sept. 10 through Sept. 16, 2011. The hotel looks beautiful...all sparkling and new. Our room was only the basic double, but was good sized, clean and very comfortable. Breakfast was the best we had at any of the hotels we stayed. The location is perhaps the best feature. Campo de Fiore is merely a few steps away and was the perfect spot for dining and enjoying an evening drink. This hotel is also just a block away from Piazza Navona and only a short scenic walk from the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, and Spanish steps. Would return to this hotel anytime!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Achillman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in July 2011 just as it opened. Very nice modern hotel in a really great location. Didn't have a room with a view but the standard of rooms is very high, big and airy. Lovely big bathroom with great shower. The pool and spa area of the hotel was still being worked on, but looked very nice. We paid 140 for a double which included breakfast. Thought this was really good value for Rome in high season.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot in town”
Reviews.Author: Marjolein56
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lunetta is 200 meters away from Piazza Navona and 50 from Campo de Fiori. Very central. It has recently been renovated, everything looks brand new. Breakfast is very good. Service with a smile and always fresh coffee. The overall welcome and service in the hotel is amazingly friendly and helpful. I have two commends: coffee/tea facilities in the room would be a plus. And: rooms are quiet, but in the top you find room 401 and 402. They are connected by a door and closets and therefore you hear every noise from your neighbour. 402 is very small, there is no fixed bed but a sleeping coach, no desk to do your work. It is rented out though as a complete room for a complete price. You do not have space there at all, the only plus for that room is the private roofterrace. I will be back for sure when in Rome, but will never take room 402 again. Also a plus is the free wifi throughout the hotel

Reviews.Title: “New hotel made for a fine stay”
Reviews.Author: westcoastvik
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Rome with my wife, 4-year old son, and father for 5 nights. We stayed in 2 rooms at the Hotel Lunetta. The hotel was very new at the time we stayed--you could still smell construction adhesive and fresh paint. Rooms were very nicely appointed. My dad's room had a queen sized bed (quoting American sizes) and our room had a king sized bed. The beds themselves were excellent. It was about 90F and humid during our stay, and the A/C worked flawlessly. With our son in tow, we spent a fair amount of time in the room, and Lunetta's rooms are a bit on the snug side. Most adult travelers won't miss the space however. The included daily continental breakfast was excellent. The staff was still training at the time of our visit, but the lead server was exceptional. The front desk staff was very solid as well. The location on Campo di Fiori is excellent if you are hitting the big tourist sites as we were. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: famjo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. The location is excellent! Only a few minutes walk to all major things to see in Rome. The service level was very high. Thge staff was competent and could give great advice. The hotel is completely new, (rebuilt) and is in modern cool style. We really liked it and can definitely recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've stayed at in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Fsraavnikno
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous when booking La Lunetta as it all looked too good to be true on the hotel website, particularly in light of the very reasonable price we paid. However, I can confirm that it is as good as the website portrays it. Having been recently entirely refurbished to a very high standard, everything is brand spanking new, spotlessly clean and in perfect working order (a rarity in Roman hotels outside the absolute top-end price bracket, and at times even within in it!), whilst retaining an elegant, old world feel (the staff explained to me that a hotel has stood on the site since the 15th century). The hotel is hidden away in a quiet quaint little square, right in the heart of the city, ideal for being in walking distance to all the main attractions, good bars and restaurants. I found the staff to be.extremely professional, friendly and attentive. All of these factors make La Lunetta the best hotel I've stayed in Rome (having stayed in quite a few). I just hope that they don't raise their prices!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: katieNotts
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in August. We booked 2 classic rooms. We were very pleased with our choice. The rooms and public areas are finished to a high standard. Air con and wifi was very reliable.The service is very friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic, set in a very central area but also quiet. Piazza Navona is within 10 minutes walk and there is a market area, with bars and restaurants, abour 2 minutes walk away. The teenagers in our group particularly liked this area. All of the major sites are within walking distance. Would definitely go back if we returned to Rome.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Lunetta
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza del Paradiso, 68, 00186 Rome, Italy
